quoteLast: Leave The Hague for Amsterdam, where I arrived at 7:30 p.m., having passed Haarlem at 6:45 p.m. At 8 o'clock, as I sat on the platform of the Oosterspoorweg Station, the bells of three different towers commenced simultaneously to chime their peals and that too with mathematical precision.
title:
The Youthful Wanderer
An Account of a Tour through England, France, Belgium, Holland, Germany and the Rhine, Switzerland, Italy, and Egypt, Adapted to the Wants of Young Americans Taking Their First Glimpses at the Old World
author: Heffner, George H.

quoteLast: on December 6, 1917, in latitude 49·23 north, longitude 6·13 west, clear weather, smooth sea, speed 13 knots zigzagging, the U. S. S.
title: World's War Events, Vol. II
author: Reynolds, Francis J. (Francis Joseph), 1867-1937 [Editor]; Churchill, Allen L. (Allen Leon), 1873-1940 [Editor]

quoteFirst: All the _Texel's_ crew were saved, but they rowed to shore and the story of her sinking was not told until they reached Atlantic City next morning. En route from Porto Rico to New York, with a cargo of sugar, the _Texel_ was stopped at
quoteLast: by the firing of shells, one of which struck the vessel, and an hour later was sunk by bombs placed aboard.
title: Our Navy at war
author: Daniels, Josephus, 1862-1948

quoteFirst: C., and Gunner Harry R. Hood, of Atlanta, Ga.--and 62 men of the crew. The _Jones_ was proceeding alone from off Brest to Queenstown when, at
quoteLast: , a torpedo was sighted rushing toward the ship. The rudder was put hard left, the destroyer put on all its speed, but could not maneuver in time to escape.
title: Our Navy at war
author: Daniels, Josephus, 1862-1948
